text: On tap at the brewpub. Pours a cloudy with a white head that lasts throughout the beer. Aroma has lots of clove and sweet wheat with a touch of light fruits. Flavor has lots of wheat and clove with a touch of banana supporting.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2016 Full pour at the brewery. A good lookig bee, some sediment in the opague yellow beer and a thick, white head. Some of banana, some clove. Moderately sweet and an acidic bite that is not expected and a little strong for the style. It looks good, but doesnt have the flavor of a hefeweizen and definitely more like a low flavor kristallweizen in the flavor.

Tap at brew pub. Light hazy orange with thick white head. Has g
Hefe nose but subtle and grainy . Taste is kinda off. Sorta amateur version of the style. Should have done better. .
Noticeable but not overpowering banana and clove notes. Nice cloudy hefe color and a decent foam head. East on the palate and overall an enjoyable, full bodies beer.
Hazy Yellow with notes of cloves, wheat, piney hops, and pale malts. Light body and low catbonation; Very smooth and tasty.
Taster at brewery. Tons of banana and yeast on this, really overpowering. Pour is a light brown.
trap at brewery. banana, clove, great blend of sweet and tart (mostly sweet). perfect on a late summer night.
On tap at Canal Park, hazy golden pour, aroma of banana, clove. Taste is similar, big clove spice finish.
Banana, yeast, spice. clean finish average carb nice color decent head. Reserved tasty sweet

Hazy gold color with a large head. Tart wheat aroma. Strong wheat flavor and quite yeasty. The hefeweizen yeast goes easy on the banana and barely and cloves, but its still solid and characterful. Very full bodied.
